name: fs.s3a.connection.request.timeout
description:
Time out on HTTP requests to the AWS service; 0 means no timeout.
    Measured in seconds; the usual time suffixes are all supported

    Important: this is the maximum duration of any AWS service call,
    including upload and copy operations. If non-zero, it must be larger
    than the time to upload multi-megabyte blocks to S3 from the client,
    and to rename many-GB files. Use with care.

    Values that are larger than Integer.MAX_VALUE milliseconds are
    converged to Integer.MAX_VALUE milliseconds

name: mapreduce.jobhistory.move.thread-count
description: The number of threads used to move files.

name: dfs.blockreport.incremental.intervalMsec
description:
If set to a positive integer, the value in ms to wait between sending
    incremental block reports from the Datanode to the Namenode.

name: ipc.ping.interval
description:
Timeout on waiting response from server, in milliseconds.
  The client will send ping when the interval is passed without receiving bytes,
  if ipc.client.ping is set to true.

name: ipc.server.purge.interval
description:
Define how often calls are cleaned up in the server.
    The default is 15 minutes. The unit is minutes.

name: dfs.datanode.slow.io.warning.threshold.ms
description:
The threshold in milliseconds at which we will log a slow
    io warning in a datanode. By default, this parameter is set to 300
    milliseconds.

name: mapreduce.job.reduces
description:
The default number of reduce tasks per job. Typically set to 99%
  of the cluster's reduce capacity, so that if a node fails the reduces can
  still be executed in a single wave.
  Ignored when mapreduce.framework.name is "local".

name: mapreduce.task.exit.timeout
description:
The number of milliseconds before a task will be
  terminated if it stays in finishing state for too long.
  After a task attempt completes from TaskUmbilicalProtocol's point of view,
  it will be transitioned to finishing state. That will give a chance for the
  task to exit by itself.
